#Text=Višegrad
#Text=Višegrad is a city on the banks of the river Drina in Sarajevo Region , Bosnia and Herzegovina .
#Text=The town is well known for its UNESCO World Heritage site , Mehmed paša Sokolović Bridge , and the poet Ivo Andrić , nobel prize winner in 1961 for the novel The Bridge over the Drina .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The Višegrad Tourism Bureau has an English website with many phone numbers and links helping visitors to the area .
#Text=Tourist Information Office at the south end of the bridge ( opposite Visegrad Hotel ) is the best source of reliable information .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Daily bus departures from Sarajevo , Banja Luka , Trebinje , Belgrade , Novi Sad , Niš , Užice .
#Text=From Sarajevo , Višegrad can be reached by the M5 road after 120 km .
#Text=There are a few daily buses from Sarajevo to Višegrad .
#Text=All buses go from the Eastern Sarajevo-Lukavica station .
#Text=To get there catch a city trolley from Skenderija centre to Dobrinja and get off at the last station .
#Text=From there , it is 150 meters to the Istocno Sarajevo bus station .
#Text=The trolley ticket was € 0.90 in summer 2009 , and the bus ticket from Sarajevo to Višegrad is around € 8 .
#Text=From Belgrade , Višegrad can be reached by the road M5 via Čačak and Uzice , after 280 km in total .
#Text=Daily buses during the whole day .
#Text=Užice to Višegrad 470 Serbian Dinars ( € 4.70 ) ( 2010 ) .

#Text=If your bus terminates in Višegrad , try to get off somewhere in the town centre , otherwise you will end up at the terminus on the south edge of town by the sports field , ( passing through a tunnel ) .
#Text=If this happens it is just a 0.5Km walk downhill to the town , 1km to the old bridge .
#Text=By train
#Text=The nearest railway station in BiH is located in Sarajevo , which is 120 km from Višegrad .
#Text=By plane
#Text=The nearest international airport in BiH is located in Sarajevo 120 km away .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Walk !
#Text=It is a small-enough , compact town best explored on foot .
#Text=See
#Text=Mehmed
#Text=Pasa Sokolovic Bridge
#Text=( Na Drini ćuprija ) .
#Text=Historic bridge from 1577 over the Drina river , a protected UNESCO World Heritage site .
#Text=Ivo Andric Monument ( Spomenik Ivi Andriću ) .
#Text=Ivo Andric House ( Kuća I ve Andrića ) .
#Text=Can be seen only from the outside .
#Text=Lotus Hotel Building ( Lotikin Hotel ) .
#Text=The former Lotus Hotel described in the novel Bridge on the Drina , can be seen only from the outside .
#Text=Marko Kraljevic Tower ( Kula Kraljevića Marka ) .
#Text=Old medieval stone tower .
#Text=Town Art Gallery ( Gradska Galerija ) .
#Text=Exhibition of pictures and sculptures .
#Text=Ivo Andric Memorial Classroom ( Spomen učionica I ve Andrića ) .
#Text=Virgin Mary Church , Crkva uspenja presvete Bogorodice .
#Text=Ortodox church from 1884 .
#Text=Dobrun Monastery ( Manastir Dobrun ) ( 12 kilometers from town ) .
#Text=14th century monastery , with frescoes from 15th century , Art gallery , Museum of the First Serbian Uprising , Museum of the Dabrobosnian Metropolitan .
#Text=Do
#Text=Visegrad spa
#Text=Višegradska banja Vilina Vlas

#Text=5 kilometers from town , old turkish bath from 16th century , one hour rent available , Hotel Vilina vlas with closed swimming pool with warm mineral water , St. Jovan church , summer terrace in spa
#Text=Boat ride on Drina river , a few of tourist boats available .
#Text=Info about boat ride at Hotel Visegrad reception
#Text=Town tour , alone or with the local tourist guide .
#Text=Cruising the Drina river canyon , additional info here
#Text=Fishing on Drina river
#Text=Swimming , boat drive , kayaking and other water sports ( Jaz beach )
#Text=Dinner in one of the Višegrad restaurants
#Text=Visit of the Visegrad spa
#Text=description at or info at the official web site of the Hotel Vilina vlas
#Text=Eat
#Text=Kruna restaurant , Kralja Petra bb , ☏ +38765626561 . 07-23.
#Text=Etno restaurant Kruna , one of the best restaurants in Višegrad , national cuisine
#Text=Hotel Višegrad restaurant , Trg palih boraca bb , ☏ +38758631051 . 07-23.

#Text=This restaurant has a best position in the town , only 50 meters from the old bridge , it looks directly on the old bridge , it also has summer terrace which is opened during the summer season .
#Text=Big variety of local food .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Night life-
#Text=live local music on Fridays and Saturdays
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Hotel Višegrad , south end of the old bridge .
#Text=Easy to find , bright yellow and pink building !
#Text=Recently modernised , clean .
#Text=€ 43 for double room with breakfast ( 2010 )
#Text=Go next
#Text=Visit Mokra Gora in Serbia , by bus ( take your passport ! ) .

#Text=It is possible to explore Drvengrad ( " Wooden town " ) - the film set for Kusturica 's film " Life is a Miracle " - and take a trip on the Sargan-8 narrow gauge mountain railway , and get back to Visegrad in one day .
#Text=Catch the Uzice -bound bus at approx 09:45 , and ask to get off at Mokra Gora station ( not the village ) .
#Text=The 13:25 train takes you up in the mountains and is due back at 15:48 , just in time to miss a bus back to Visegrad !
#Text=Next bus is approx 18:15 - 18:30 but check with the owner of the station restaurant , who seems to have the most reliable information .
#Text=The narrow gauge railway all the way from Visegrad to Mokra Gora is being restored .
#Text=It was not open June 2010 but was expected to be open by the end of the year .
#Text=This should be a major tourist attraction when it is fully operational .
